data.text: @flightradar24 Indiscriminate mortar firing? Or intentional? Curious what people think.
@flightradar24 Natonov can fuck right off now
@flightradar24 Quem ama aviação, sabe que ele deixará saudades.
@korky329 @jpam57979932 @flightradar24 So it was a lose-lose for them, they were stuck in a hard place and the outcome is the loss of the best feat of Soviet aeronautical engineering unfortunately

@korky329 @jpam57979932 @flightradar24 Globally there are very few airports with the capacity to house an aircraft as big as the An-225 and store it for long term. It would also cause diplomacy and political fiascos, and antonov would have to pay the foreign country who is housing the An-225

@kovacp911 @jpam57979932 @flightradar24 I think the aircraft last flew out during early February @flightradar24 and more could have been done e.g ferry to safe haven and do maintenance elsewhere if required or wait until the threat of war is over.

@AstraLyne_x @korky329 @jpam57979932 @flightradar24 I am not sure whether Antonov had any contingency planning. I think the aircraft last flew out during early February and more could have been done e.g ferry to safe haven and do maintenance elsewhere if required or wait until the threat of war is over.@AntonovCompany
@jpam57979932 @flightradar24 An engineering marvel now in ruins https://t.co/VNmYln9ZhZ
